intro: Ornithogalum desertorum, commonly known as the desert star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of white or pale blue flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is adapted to survive in low-water environments. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is often found in rocky soils and sandy plains. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
